Yep, Christmas was bomb. Still had to work. Have to work New Years, too. Work might just caught up a holiday gift finally. My friend Kaios is going to get me some kitty ears like the one's she had for her raver outfit. I don't feel like going into any detail right now.

Need to type up and post a few things. Need to get Holly a birthday present. Need to start playing Jak 2. Need to reorganize my room. Need to work more on my story. Need to get my car paid off. Need to work on my music ideas. Need to think about moving out. Need to start working on my car. Need something less than a girlfriend but more than a regular friend. Need to get a new job. Need to publish my poetry. Need to get music equipment.

Boy, this year is going to be busy.

Do not discount what I believe just because I do not have all the answers.

I don't want to work tonight, nor do I want to work next Saturday. Need to buy Dutchie's gift and need to give Kat and Jon's respected gifts. Need to find inspiration for my poems. Hope whatever Jon gives me for my music will help me get going on my grand idea. I need to get Holly a birthday gift but will be unable to until my first paycheck of the new year. Once that is done, I will finally be able to get focus back on my car and music. I think I will focus on minor things for my car until it is paid off. Currently, I must get back into the groove of saving up the lump sum to help pay off the car early. I will get the new bezel and taillight...then I have a problem. Because of what I want to do next, I do not have anything beyond that to do, which seems like a waste of time. But I can't do much of anything until Roxanne is paid in full. I'll focus on my music until then. Lots to do, the time of my dreams are soon at hand.

Dad got a $1.02. Holly will most likely keep her job. I got my raise. Mom will get a raise with the new year. Grandparents have a new home and have no more outstanding debt. Presents wrap around the Christmas tree. This year is the best we've had since we moved from Coronado. Life is good.

Must I give solid proof of what I believe in before someone will accept my views as a valid option? Most of what we believe in based on theory, a idea which has too many unanswered questions to be a fact and/or truth. Yet, more people are willing to believe these unproven ideals before they will put faith in a god. There is about the same amount of evidence for both...and an equal amount against each. For all the some of my friends respect me and my faith, I don't think any of the take me seriously. I'm not the shining example of what a true Christian should be but I try. Jon said once that I was the most level headed (or liberal, whichever) Christian he'd met. But he always points out the flaws in my faith. I don't care what you think or how you view me, just show some respect and learn that sometimes it's better not to say things. I've had to learn that, too. Why must they use my own lack of knowledge to try and prove their point. Just because I don't have all the answers does not make my point any less valid. 

It's interesting that it's those who do have the love of their parents are just as likely to end up killing people as those who did not. "I did not think he could do it." and "I never noticed him much." These phrases are said of those who came from loving homes and still went 'mad'. Those who use the excuse that daddy wasn't there and people pick on me are just hiding from reality. I was picked on, I was the least liked kid in school; but I don't let it effect my life in that way. My parents weren't always what I'd want them to be but I love them just the same. The point is that you choose where your life goes and how things turn out. Take responsibility and make something of your life. The world be damned, who cares about them? You do, because you keep bitching about them. If they do not matter, the stop blaming them for your current status.

Santa Russell worked out well. Everyone was happy with what they got. Adam gave me his present, and it is truly wonderful. Got mom's and dad's presents tonight. Just need Kat's and Dutchie's. Also got a kool mixed CD from Adam's mom. Ate out with JP and his father yesterday. Had a big religious/philosophical/social discussion with a bunch of friends. My skills in Halo 2 on-line are improving. I need to do more story work on GTA:SA. I don't want to work this weekend...or the next. But I do what I must. No new poems or any progress on my story. Jon said he would help me get some software to get me started on my music...that should make me happy, so why am I still so sad?

Well, my work with the presents is almost done. All I need to get now is Kim her present and JP something more than what I already have for him. Santa Russell may still work. I have the hat, I just need the sack. Saturday & Sunday will be a bitch. I will have to buy Kim's gift that day. I don't want to get her candles but I'm not totally sure if I got the two series she wants for her DVD collection. I think I know what Derek told me when I wrote it down but I was in the middle of sleeping. Here's what I wrote on the paper: "NaaIica DVD 2", "Pbxhnlytb & Rexhnlybe DVD 3". The first should be Nadesico and the second...I think it's RahXephon. This is why you never call me when I'm sleeping. JP on the other hand, now that his shipment was canceled, I don't know. He has one small item but I want to get him something more. Lots to do still. We got a Nobel Spruce from this tree farm in Covington. We cut it down ourselves. They charged by type, not size. $40.00 for this 6'4" beautiful tree. Love the smell. Star and Spangle were all big-eyed. My pants were all muddy and wet. I kinda feel bad for cutting it down though. I just don't want bad tree karma, I guess. We'll put decorations on it later this week. We got the first set of Christmas lights up on our house but all this high winds and stuff have been blowing them down and all over. Hopefully things will settle down so we can use them.

Poeted a poem on DeviantART. Been slow with them. Been gaining more watchers and friends. Currently, I have 78 watchers. I need to make a new profile. I want to visit Australia. I have so many friends over there and it's a place I've wanted to explore for a very long time. Well, I can dream for the moment. If my music lends me the money to do so, it will be on hell of an adventure. It seems ButtercupSaiyan and Neverm0reX have parted ways. Honestly, I'm not too surprised. She still wants me to do the music, for which I am very happy. I will start on getting everything I need once the holidays are over. My car will sadly have to wait. I've been talking some friends at work and I really give up; I don't know what to do outside of getting a new car. Neither of them like my car, it's an automatic and there is no clear-cut answer I can find. I would like to make my final decision based on something more concrete. No matter, Roxanne will rule any automatic out there and most ricers, too. That reminds me, on Saturday, Mom and Holly show up asking me what I wanted for Christmas...and for the first time in my life, I had no answer. Most things that I want are too expensive for others to buy and usually too specific. Plus, I budget for them and I like doing it on my own. (though any help is nice) Besides that, most small things I get on my own anyway. I've become very selfrelient in that respect. I found it so hard to give them idea's so I hope the did ok. Well, Holly will make sure of that...though I'm not sure if I should be happy about that. J/K!

Speaking of Holly, I'm starting to get really annoyed with how things are turning out for her. She does her best, shows so much promise and yet time after time she keeps getting the short end of the stick because some dumb-ass decided they felt threatened by her. Which they should, in a way; she's the most self-confident women I know and has great leadership potential. How can she grow in this world when all she ever gets is shit? Well, I can only sit on the sidelines and watch...prehaps even give some advice now and again. I only hope see keeps at it, for that is the only way she'll survive. But of both of these, I am relativity sure of.

Umm, this weekend will be up in the air as usual. Will try to get the rest of the presents taken care of.
